title: Who left Strictly? Anneka Rice voted off as Kevin Clifton makes earliest exit ever

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 has lost another celebrity, as Anneka Rice and her professional dance partner Kevin Clifton became the second couple to leave the show.

The TV legend found herself in the dreaded dance-off against David James and his partner Nadiya Bychkova.

Both pairings were tasked with performing for a second time, as their fates remained in the hands of the judges.

Craig Revel Horwood, Shirley Ballas, Bruno Tonioli and new judge Motsi Mabuse then had to reveal the couple they wished to save, and the vote was unanimous.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Judge Craig was first to reveal his verdict, saving David and Nadiya.

He said: "For commitment and improvement, I’d like to save David & Nadiya."

Motsi echoed this vote, adding: "I felt a more emotional show, a stronger couple - I’m going to save David & Nadiya.”

(Image: PA)

Bruno was next, and he said: "I would go for the couple that was more convincing and that delivered more under pressure, the performance was up a notch from Saturday night. David & Nadiya.”

With three votes out of four saving David, Head Judge Shirley didn't need to vote but she said she too would have chosen the same couple.

She said: "Yes, I would have also saved David & Nadiya.”

(Image: PA)

This is the earliest last year's champion Kevin has left the series, with him having been in almost every final since he joined the show.

Viewers took to Twitter over the result, with one fan commenting: "Kevin went from winning to being the second couple out."

Another said: "Poor Kevin, he’s never been gone this quick! "

A third commented: "Kevin’s not used to going out this early. "

Strictly Come Dancing airs Saturdays and Sundays on BBC One.
description: Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton were the second couple to leave Strictly Come Dancing 2019, with the result announced on Sunday
